duties_responsibilities.duty: Advance patient safety programs and promote a culture of safety, while eliminating avoidable harm.
Initiate and oversee proactive evaluation and redesign of systems to improve care processes.
Emphasize both appropriate behaviors and robust systems to support improved outcomes.
Effectively report, investigate, and analyze patient safety incidents, medical errors, and potential risks in the facility.
Facilitate thorough and credible serious event analysis and failure mode effect analysis to identify and mitigate unintended adverse patient outcomes.

Champion the completion of Culture of Safety Survey and partner with facility leadership to establish activities that enable and sustain an open and fair environment promoting learning and safe systems.
Work with legal counsel to coordinate the investigation, processing, and defense of claims against the facility.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor's Degree is required; Master's degree preferred. Certified Professional Patient Safety (CPPS) must be obtained within 1 year of employment start date.
